Instrument_Host.name: The Gravity Recovery and Interior Laboratory A Spacecraft
Instrument_Host.description: The Gravity Recovery and Interior Laboratory A (GRAIL-A) spacecraft is one of two nearly identical spacecraft, designed based on Lockheed Martin Experimental Small Satellite-11 and NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. The payload of the spacecraft includes a Lunar Gravity Ranging System (LGRS) to precisely measure the changes in range between GRAIL-A and GRAIL-B and a MoonKAM lunar-imager for public outreach. The LGRS mapped the gravitational field of the Moon and determined its interior structure.
